Phobia reached back into his storage compartment and pulled out the 
holocube."These plans should give you the edge you need." He knew he 
had her hook line and sinker.

"Now what would you like done about Terrorsaur? his loyalty to 
Megatron bothers me, I am at your command." He held back a grin that 
could give away his intentions. "Pull this mission off and the 
council will think again about your worth, probably make you an 
honorable leader in the Predacon military with a big promotion." The 
power behind the thrown was the sweetest taste a Predacon could 
experience. The leaders would blame the lackeys and the lackeys would 
blame the leaders, nobody would blame him.

-- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::KitKat::
> 
> She jumped up,"What? expendable. I am not expendable like that.  
> megatron may thing so, but I don't. No, I will not let myy team 
jsut 
> get wiped out and not have anything to show for it." She had 
renewed 
> confidence in herself.  She felt like she could lead this group, 
and 
> into victory as well.  "Phobia, did I hear you correctly earlier 
> saying you had the plans for the ships? Can I have a look at them 
> please?"
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > (Did they ask Terrorsaur or Phobia to lead?)
> > 
> > "You do whats the best for all in your group, my dear that is 
what 
> > makes you the ideal leader." again he emphasised the word 
> > leader " "You can lead, all you need to do is show a little 
force." 
> > most Predacons knew the basic rules of leadership "Never look 
down 
> on 
> > a subordinate, lowering your head shows weekness. Never 
contradict 
> > your own orders, Know your teams functions and capabilities, and 
> most 
> > of all Never turn your back after a defeat, theres always someone 
> > looking for that oppertunity." He thought about the Irony of the 
> > situation Megatron nearly got everyone killed and now they're 
> having 
> > this discussion.
> > 
> > "Megatrons told you you're nothing so many times you believe it, 
> it's 
> > basic psychological breeding." Another irony crossed his mind, a 
> > Psychological warfare specialist telling a Predacon not to listen 
> to 
> > psychological warfare. "With the Iron Fist at your controls would 
> > Megatron challenge you or cringe before you?" he shifted his 
weight 
> > to the other foot "And when you destroy the Cybertronian Fire 
would 
> > anyone question your abilities?
> > 
> > "You have a choice to Make KitKat, would you rather live trying 
to 
> > improve the Predacons? or die as a pawn to Megatron? Only one 
> choice 
> > gives you a chance at survival." Inside Phobia thought that they 
> both 
> > knew the answer but just in case he added "Besides Megatron and 
his 
> > army have been deemed as expendable acording to the council, Do 
you 
> > believe you belong on that list too?"
> >
